page.title: 05FARMING 1
page.content: This area was once sea and swamp land and most of the land is sand stone. It is very flat and is covered in clay because there was sea. It is very flat and is on the Lancashire plain. elling hill is made of sandstone. Mr. Morrey owns Giddygate Farm. He farms l74 acres. Most of the land is used for grass. He frows cabbage, sprouts, potatoes, wheat and barley. He sells his ptatoes bulk to East Riding Farm Produce Ltd. Mr. Morrey told us that 72 farmers get together and all the potatoes that are picked are sent to one co-operative and are sorted out by a big machine. If you are on your own you wouldn't be able to afford a machine. When they get together it is called a co-operative. The co-operatives sell to the big Supermarkets.
